title: A highly-sensitive sandwich ELISA procedure based on one-step antibody immobilization for potential _in vitro_ diagnostics
procedures:
**Ab immobilization and BSA blocking   TIMING 1 h**
1. Mix anti-HFA capture Ab \(8 µg mL<sup>-1</sup>) with 1% \(v/v) APTES in the ratio of 1:1 \(v/v). Incubate each of the desired wells of a 96-well MTP with 100 μL of the freshly prepared anti-HFA capture Ab solution, with a final concentration of 4 µg mL<sup>-1</sup> in 0.5% APTES, for 30 min at RT. Wash five times with 300 μL of 0.1M PBS, pH 7.4. Washing can also be performed with an automatic plate washer. 
  2. Block the Ab-bound wells with 300 µL of 1% \(w/v) BSA for 30 min at 37°C followed by extensive PBS washing \(as mentioned in step 1).  **CRITICAL STEP** Use filtered BSA to remove any microbial or other contaminants. **?TROUBLESHOOTING**
  
**HFA sandwich ELISA    TIMING 2 h 45 min**
3. Add 100 µL of varying HFA concentrations \(4.9 pg mL<sup>-1</sup>-20 ng mL<sup>-1</sup>) to different BSA-blocked wells. Incubate for 1 h at 37°C and wash extensively with PBS \(as stated in step 1).
  4. Add 100 µL of biotinylated anti-HFA Ab \(200 ng mL<sup>-1</sup>) in each of the HFA-captured wells. Incubate for 1 h at 37 °C and wash extensively with PBS \(as mentioned in step 1).
  5. Add 100 µL of streptavidin-HRP conjugate \(diluted 1:200) to the biotinylated anti-HFA Ab treated wells. Incubate for 20 min at 37°C and wash extensively with PBS \(as mentioned in step 1). **?TROUBLESHOOTING** 
  6. Add 100 µL of TMB-H<sub>2</sub>O<sub>2</sub> mixture to each of these wells and incubate at RT to develop color for 20 min. **?TROUBLESHOOTING**
  7. Stop the enzyme-substrate reaction by adding 50 µL of 1 N H<sub>2</sub>SO<sub>4</sub> to each well.

8. Determine the absorbance at a primary wavelength of 450 nm taking 540 nm as the reference wavelength in the Tecan Infinite M200 Pro microplate reader.  **CRITICAL STEP** Determine the absorbance within 10 min of stopping the enzyme substrate reaction.
